publications.name: Federated Learning Under Heterogeneous and Correlated Client Availability
publications.publisher: IEEE INFOCOM 2023, IEEE/ACM Transactions on Networking
publications.summary: This paper presents the first convergence analysis for a federated learning algorithm under heterogeneous and correlated client availability. Our analysis highlights how correlation adversely affects the algorithm’s convergence rate and how the aggregation strategy can alleviate this effect.

publications.name: FedStale: Leveraging Stale Updates in Federated Learning
publications.summary: This paper introduces FedStale, a novel federated learning algorithm that updates the global model in each round through a convex combination of “fresh” updates from participating clients and “stale” updates from non-participating ones.

publications.name: Client heterogeneity in federated learning systems
publications.summary: This thesis focuses on providing a theoretical understanding of federated learning systems under heterogeneous client participation, analyzing the impact of this heterogeneity on the convergence of federated learning algorithms, and proposing practical solutions for a more efficient system and resource usage.
